gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਘਾੳੁ ਘਾੲਿਲ ਕੋ ਜਤਨ ਕੈ ਨੀਕੋ ਹੋਤ ਪੀਰ ਮਿਟਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਲੀਕ ਮਿਟਤ ਨ ਪੇਖੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Ghaau Ghaail Ko Jatan Kai Neeko Hota , Peer Miti Jaai Leek Mitat N Paykheeai ?
translation: Just as the wound gets cured with medicine and the pain also vanishes, but the scar of the wound is never seen to vanish.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਫਾਟੇ ਅੰਬਰੋ ਸੀਅਾੲਿ ਪੁਨਿ ਓਢੀਅਤ ਨਾਗੋ ਤੳੁ ਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਤੳੂ ਥੇਗਰੀ ਪਰੇਖੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Dhaatay Anbaro Seeaai Pouni Aoddheeata , Naago Tau N Hoi Taoo Daygaree Paraykheeai ?
translation: Just as a torn cloth stitched and worn does not bare the body but the seam of the stitch is visible and conspicuous.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਟੂਟੈ ਬਾਸਨੁ ਸਵਾਰ ਦੇਤ ਹੈ ਠਠੇਰੋ ਗਿਰਤ ਨ ਪਾਨੀ ਪੈ ਗਠੀਲੋ ਭੇਖ ਭੇਖੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Tootai Baasanu Savaar Dayt Hai Tthatthayro , Girat N Paanee Pai Gattheelo Bhaykh Bhaykheeai ?
translation: Just as a broken utensil is repaired by coppersmith and even the water does not leak from it, but it is repaired form stays.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨਿ ਬਿਮੁਖ ਦੁਖ ਦੇਖਿ ਪੁਨਿ ਸਰਨ ਗਹੇ ਪੁਨੀਤ ਪੈ ਕਲੰਕੁ ਲੇਖ ਲੇਖੀਅੈ ||੪੧੯||
transliteration: Taisay Gur Charani Bimoukh Doukh Daykhi Pouni , Saran Gahay Pouneet Pai Kalanku Laykh Laykheeai ?419?
translation: Similarly, a disciple who has turned away from the holy feet of the True Guru comes back to the Guru's refuge when he feels the pain of his actions. Although he is freed of his sins and becomes pious, yet the .blemish of his apostasy remains.  (419)
